intro.paragraph1: I'm Mike, and this is my corner of the internet to share my passion for the night sky. I created this space to both showcase my astrophotography work and record my journey in this hobby, so that I could go back and see the very first images I've taken, and how the quality has (hopefully) improved over time.

journey.title: The Journey
journey.paragraph1: I've always been fascinated with the night sky and the photos other people take, and finally have decided to pull the plug and give it a go myself in late Fall of 2024. Mostly with the stuff I already had: a Sony camera and a long telephoto zoom, aside from the entry-level Skywatcher GoTo mount.
journey.paragraph2: Currently based in the UAE, I'm fortunate to have access to dark skies and clear nights most of the year, even if I have to drive pretty far out of the city.
journey.paragraph3: My primary locations are the test site at the
journey.paragraph3b: , a light polluted place, but close to home, and the main shooting site at
journey.paragraph3c: , the darkest place in the country.
journey.paragraph4: I'm always looking for new places to shoot, so if you know of any good spots in the UAE, please let me know!

setup.title: The Setup
setup.paragraph1: For now, it's a Sony A7IV full-frame camera with a GM 100-400 f4.5-5.6 lens, the SkyWatcher GTi tracking mount, on top of a Peak Design tripod.
setup.paragraph2: The brains of operation the holy Ktulhu of wires and a Windows 11 mini-PC running N.I.N.A.
setup.paragraph2b: I also got a n Anker battery, that, with some power target tweaking of the PC, can support up to 7 hours of shooting. If switched to 12v output via car plug, potentially I can extend it even more, but I'm yet to give that a try.
